ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I love all the writing process as they taught me how I write and let me tried different types of writing.
This course taught me techniques for writing a personal essay along with critical reading strategies to help decipher what makes an essay successful.
I learned not only about nonfiction writing but also about introspection and critical analysis.
This course helped me better develop my creative writing skills

I got to read so many cool essayists and their works, and through analyzing their writing I learned a lot about critically analyzing texts and what choices writers make to enhance their work. The writing part of the class taught me a lot about how to use the essay as a form of personal expression and how to be a better writer overall.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength : love the workshop(seeing people's feedback and reading others' great works, very managae and stable workload (5 units, having 1 draft and 1 edit each 1~2 week, it's always like that), not stress in grading
Weakness: Can't think of, maybe have less reading but more focus on one or two(depth)

Strengths:
The discussion model for the class enhances learning and fosters relationships between students. 

Wekanesses:
None

Strengths - Reading are mostly manageable and not overly lengthy. Essay prompts are fun and applicable to everyone's lives. In class essay workshops are a great way to receive peer input on your essay. 

Weaknesses - none

Professor Walls was the greatest strength of the course. Being in class felt like you were constantly in conversation with him, both in class discussions and through assignments and office hours. He always paid close attention to every observation each student made or what kind of topics were brought up in office hours conversations, and tied all of it back to their writing. He was also so passionate about all the texts we were talking about in class, as well as getting to know his students as people and giving specific feedback to improve their work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Definitely take it. I am sad that I cannot take it again.
Yes, I would recommend this course to any students who are interested in writing or not. The format of the essays allows the student to be creative and write about their own experience.
Absolutely. This is a course anyone can take, no matter their writing capabilities going in. Applicable to living in today's world where good writing is an invaluable skill.
yes! especially if taken with Professor Seth Walls!

Absolutely, and if you can, take it with Professor Walls. I loved the readings and the writing assignments, and I really felt like this class was my outlet to express myself and my ideas. I think this course is great for both people who already love writing and those who haven't been as exposed to it, because the personal essay is such a great medium that lets anyone write using their own strengths.
